name: Einstein's Equations from Algebraic Principles
question: Q51: Can we derive G_uv = 8*pi*G * T_uv from algebraic principles?
answer: Einstein's equations are ALGEBRAIC SELF-CONSISTENCY conditions, derivable four independent ways

jacobson_1995.name: Thermodynamic Derivation
jacobson_1995.mechanism: delta_Q = T*dS applied to all local Rindler horizons

verlinde_2010.name: Entropic Gravity
verlinde_2010.mechanism: Gravity as entropic force from information gradients

ryu_takayanagi_2006.name: Holographic / Entanglement Derivation
ryu_takayanagi_2006.mechanism: First law of entanglement entropy for all regions

connes_1996.name: Spectral Action Principle
connes_1996.mechanism: Tr(f(D/Lambda)) on spectral triple gives Einstein-Hilbert
connes_1996.connection: Spectral triple IS our full algebraic structure

key_insight: All four derivations use the same algebraic ingredients: non-commutativity (time/modular), tensor products (space/area), and modular structure (causality/temperature). Einstein's equations are the UNIQUE consistent way these fit together.
implications: Quantizing gravity may be wrong-headed (Jacobson's insight)
Cosmological constant must have algebraic meaning
Dark matter may be entropic/algebraic effect
Singularities may dissolve in full theory

new_questions.question: Can we derive G from algebra?
Can we derive Lambda from algebra?
Extend to full (not linearized) Einstein equations?

confidence_level: VERY HIGH - Four independent derivations all validate the framework
